SEARCH
Package coding201.gui

Class ClubSetup

java.lang.Object
coding201.gui.ClubSetup
public class ClubSetup extends Object
clubSetup This method is responsible for setting up the club page. It takes in user data such as the name of the club, the difficulty setting and the number of weeks the user wants to play for It utilizes both Java Swing and java to create a gui with multiple JPanels.
Version:
1.0
Author:
tve21, bro82

  • Method Details

    • setupFrame

      public void setupFrame(MainFrame frame, JPanel clubPanel, Stadium stadium, PlayerClub userClub, Store store)
      \ The constructor here take in a frame, a panel, an instance of a PlayerClub, Store and stadium. it also sets the bounds of the initial jPanel, before calling the appropriate method that gets the intended name of the club
      Parameters:
      frame - the mainframe that creates the whole frame.
      clubPanel - the panel that the class will be built upon.
      stadium - An instance of stadium was initialized in the gameEnvironment class before being passed through
      userClub - a playerClub that is initialized in the gameEnvironment before being passed through.
      store - an instance of the store that is also created in the gameEnvironment class

    • setWeeksToPlay

      public void setWeeksToPlay()
      \ The method gathers information from the user specifying how many weeks they would like to play for. The number ranges from 5-15 and utilizes a JSlider with ticks at each integer value between those parameters. It then sets the variable in the stadium class, weekstoPlay, to the variable from the JSlider.

    • setDifficulty

      public void setDifficulty()
      \ This method uses radio buttons to get a specified difficulty from the user. There are three possible values, Easy, Medium and Hard. The difference between the 3 is the starting money, easy gives $150, medium uses $100, hard uses $50.

    • getSelectedButton

      public String getSelectedButton()
      \ The method iterates through the radio buttons, before returning the string value associated with the button Then the value for the string is passed back into the method above
      Returns:
      String value for the difficulty setting

    • getMoney

      public int getMoney()
      \ Depending on the value of the difficulty string, the initial balance will be set by the method below.
      Returns:
      int money

    • getTextFromTextField

      public void getTextFromTextField()
      \ A method that gets the club name by reading the input from the given text field. The input has to be between 3-15 characters and can only contain numbers and letters. The name is then set using the variable stored inside the PlayerClub before
